info.description:
You can use Oracle REST APIs to manage data stored in Oracle B2C Service.

You can use this guide to find:

  • A quick start that walks you through a request example.
  • Use cases with real-world solutions with code examples.
  • Detailed descriptions for each REST resource.

This document describes features available to users under Oracle B2C Service, Oracle Service Cloud, and Oracle RightNow Service Cloud licensing agreements.
info.title: REST API for Oracle B2C Service
info.x-summary: You can use Oracle REST APIs to manage data stored in Oracle B2C Service.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the message base.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The list of attributes used to determine the order in which the records are returned. The syntax contains a comma delimited string of attributes, with each attribute optionally followed by 'asc' or 'desc'. Specify 'asc' for ascending order and 'desc' for descending order. The default value is 'asc'.
For example: ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description:
The list of attributes that should be returned in the response. The syntax contains a comma delimited string of attributes.
For example: ?fields=attribute1,attribute2
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description:
The query parameter that allows searching by providing ROQL 'where' clause filtering.
For example: ?q=id>2 and id<10
parameters.name: q

parameters.description:
The requested page size, which limits the number of records returned in the response.
For example: ?limit=100
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The starting position of the record. For example, if you set an offset of 8, the request will skip the first eight records, and include the records from the ninth record in the response. The default value is 0, which means that the records will be returned from the first record.
For example: ?offset=8
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description:
Indicates whether the count for the total number of records returned should be shown. The default value is false.
If you set the value of totalResults as true, the response will include the count of records retrieved by the request.
Example response:"totalResults": 27
parameters.name: totalResults

For example: ?q=id>2 and id<10
parameters.name: q

parameters.description:
The requested page size, which limits the number of records returned in the response.
For example: ?limit=100
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The starting position of the record. For example, if you set an offset of 8, the request will skip the first eight records, and include the records from the ninth record in the response. The default value is 0, which means that the records will be returned from the first record.
For example: ?offset=8
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description:
Indicates whether the count for the total number of records returned should be shown. The default value is false.
If you set the value of totalResults as true, the response will include the count of records retrieved by the request.
Example response:"totalResults": 27
parameters.name: totalResults

parameters.description:
The list of attributes used to determine the order in which the records are returned. The syntax contains a comma delimited string of attributes, with each attribute optionally followed by 'asc' or 'desc'. Specify 'asc' for ascending order and 'desc' for descending order. The default value is 'asc'.
For example: ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description:
The list of attributes that should be returned in the response. The syntax contains a comma delimited string of attributes.
For example: ?fields=attribute1,attribute2
parameters.name: fields

accounts-attributes.description: The group of flags used for setting certain features or special behaviors for an account.

viewsReportsDisabled.description: Indicates whether the staff member's account cannot be included in the list for filters in reports. The default value is false.

infrequentUser.description: Indicates whether the staff member is considered as an infrequent user seat, as opposed to a full seat. The default value is false.

permanentlyDisabled.description: Indicates whether the staff member's account is permanently disabled. For example, an account is permanently disabled when a staff member leaves your organization. A disabled account appears in the tree of the Staff Accounts management console if Show Disabled setting is enabled, but you cannot deselect the Permanently Disable check box if you edit the account. You can reuse the login name of a permanently disabled account for a different account. The default value is false.

accountLocked.description: Indicates whether the account is temporarily locked. For example, you may lock a staff member's account who has taken a leave of absence. An account automatically gets locked if the staff member has exceeded the number of invalid login attempts or if the password has expired. The default value is false.

forcePasswordChange.description: Indicates whether the staff member must change the password at the next login. The value remains true until the staff member changes the password. The default value is false.

virtualAccount.description: Indicates whether the staff member's account is virtual. The default value is false. This attribute is read-only.

passwordNeverExpires.description: Indicates whether the staff member's account password never expires. This setting overrides system-wide password expiration configurations. The default value is false.

canModifyEmailSignature.description: Indicates whether the staff member can modify the email signature. The default value is false.

staffAssignmentDisabled.description: Indicates whether the staff member's account cannot be assigned to incidents, answers, opportunities, and tasks. The default value is false.

tags.name: Account Groups
tags.description: The Account Groups resource allows you to group staff accounts for better organization.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: The account represents a staff member in Oracle B2C Service. Examples of staff members are customer sales representatives, sales agents, site administrators, and so on.

tags.name: Analytics Report Results
tags.description: The analytics report results that supports the execution of analytics reports in Oracle B2C Service.

tags.name: Analytics Reports
tags.description: The analytics report definition that provides descriptions of a report's output columns, search criteria, and other components.

tags.name: Answer Versions
tags.description: The versioned instance of an answer. Answers are solutions to common customer support questions. These questions and answers are maintained in the Oracle B2C Service knowledge base.

tags.name: Answers
tags.description: The knowledge base information that provides solutions to the common customer support questions.

tags.name: Asset Statuses
tags.description: The status of the assets, namely product and services that are registered and tracked in Oracle B2C Service. The default asset statuses are active, retired, and unregistered.

tags.name: Assets
tags.description: The product or service associated with an organization's customers.

tags.name: Bulk Extract Results
tags.description: The results of bulk extracts containing information about the object records retrieved from Oracle B2C Service.

tags.name: Bulk Extracts
tags.description: The parameters of the bulk extract job.

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description: The information on email marketing campaigns created in Oracle B2C Service Outreach Cloud Service.

tags.name: Channel Types
tags.description: The social channels tracked in contact records when storing social account user names and associating social monitor incidents to contacts.

tags.name: Chats
tags.description: The real-time, two-way dialog between a customer and one or more chat agents.

tags.name: Configurations
tags.description: The information about the configuration settings within Oracle B2C Service.

tags.name: Contact Marketing Rosters
tags.description: The information about the contact lists used in audiences in Oracle B2C Service Outreach Cloud Service.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: The customers or end users of Oracle B2C Service site. A contact contains basic information such as a customer's name, email address, and phone number. It also contains information about customer service issues, opportunities, and marketing mailings subscription status.

tags.name: Countries
tags.description: The details about the countries and provinces which are used to maintain accurate address information for the organizations and contacts in Oracle B2C Service.

tags.name: Event Subscriptions
tags.description: The event-based subscription management object that allows external applications to discover objects that can be subscribed.

tags.name: Holidays
tags.description: The list of holidays in your organization.

tags.name: Incident Response
tags.description: The activity on an incident, including the original question, agent response and updates, customer updates, records of conversations, and internal notes about the incident.

tags.name: Incidents
tags.description: The question or the request for help submitted by a customer through the Ask a Question page, email, a chat session, site or answer feedback, or from an external source using the API. Incidents can also be added by agents when they work with customers by phone, fax, or mail.

tags.name: Mailboxes
tags.description: The mailbox used for collecting email inquiries sent by customers, responses to mailings, and bounced messages.

tags.name: Marketing Mailboxes
tags.description: The mailbox used to send and receive emails and process bounced messages.

tags.name: Message Bases
tags.description: The editable text string that allows international language support and customization of headings, labels, buttons, and other text in the administration interface and customer portal. It also applies to email messages and notifications.

tags.name: Opportunities
tags.description: The information about a specific sale or a pending deal with a contact or an organization that is tracked and maintained in the Oracle B2C Service knowledge base.

tags.name: Opportunity Statuses
tags.description: The information about the default and custom opportunity statuses and their corresponding types. The default opportunity statuses are Lead, Reject, Active, Closed, Lost, Inactive, and Dead.

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description: The company, business unit of a large company, or government agency that has an organization record in the Oracle B2C Service knowledge base.

tags.name: Purchased Products
tags.description: The information about a purchased product.

tags.description: The results from ROQL query.

tags.description: The Single Sign On (SSO) token used for authentication.

tags.name: Sales Products
tags.description: The items or services sold by an organization. Sales products are available to customers through quotes and promotions.

tags.name: Sales Territories
tags.description: The specific geographical sales region. Sales representatives can be assigned specific territories for opportunity assignment.

tags.name: Service Categories
tags.description: The hierarchical service category that provides an option to group answers and incidents for better organization and refined searching in the knowledge base.

tags.name: Service Dispositions
tags.description: The hierarchical service disposition that provides an option for classifying and recording how incidents are ultimately resolved.

tags.name: Service Mailboxes
tags.description: The email box dedicated to collect email inquiries sent by customers.

tags.name: Service Products
tags.description: The hierarchical service product that provides an option to group answers and incidents for better organization and refined searching in the knowledge base.

tags.name: Site Interfaces
tags.description: The console, windows, and pages used by staff members and customers to access the application and interact with a single knowledge base. The interface name determines the URL for the web site, the name of the system executables, and the .cfg directory name.

tags.name: Standard Contents
tags.description: The preformed text or HTML content that can be sent to customers when responding to incidents, appended to responses by a business rule, or sent by an agent during a chat session.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description: The information about an action or an activity scheduled to be completed within a specified time. Tasks can be standalone or they can be associated with answers, campaigns, contacts, documents, incidents, mailings, opportunities, organizations, surveys, and stages in a sales strategy.

tags.name: Variables
tags.description: A shortcut defined for a larger string that can be inserted in the body of an answer or inserted inline during a chat session. When the variable is inserted in the body of the answer or in a chat response, it is replaced with the value specified in the variable.
